instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00426 no trackpad or keyboard except power button. Liquid damage
threads.message:
Hi there! I know these are a pain to do due to the lack of schematics and board views. Had quite some damage on the trackpad connector so have replaced that perfectly, however I have noticed that so many lines are short on the trackpad which I'm pretty sure are not meant to be ground. When plugging in the trackpad with new cable, the computer will end in a boot loop. so it will start only with that disconnected. 

And for the keyboard there is a chip on the other side of the board which on similar models is in charge of keyboard functionality, that looks toasty. However, I'm not sure if I can use some of my donors from other models?

threads.title: 820-00426 no trackpad or keyboard except power button. Liquid damage
threads.message: wait I forgot to mention, while it does recognise and charge the battery, it won't stay on battery and won't start with battery either

threads.title: 820-00426 no trackpad or keyboard except power button. Liquid damage
threads.message: Tried new battery and trackpad flex?

threads.title: 820-00426 no trackpad or keyboard except power button. Liquid damage
threads.message:
Do you get 3V3_G3H on battery only?

Usually, keyboard controller chip has embedded firmware...
